result.execSummary:
The defendant Micah J Sterling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With Huber.  Straight time if imposed.  
Sentence credit of 3 days was granted.
*Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County.  No electronic monitoring allowed if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No violent contact with: Alvis S. or any family member.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah J Sterling

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Micah J Sterling in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

180 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 3 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**   Note:  No electronic monitoring allowed if revoked

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with:  Alvis S. or any family member

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($350.00 and remainder due as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Micah J Sterling in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis states that Defendant is in counseling and requests an adjournment so Defendant can complete counseling.  State does not object.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed. NOTE:  Copies of letter from Alvis S. provided to the state and Attorney Schleis.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
